intro.para: The dot product is an operation which receives as input two vectors in \RNr[n], and which delivers as output a number. With the aid of the algebraic and geometric properties of the dot product, this number can lead to the norm of a vector, the angle between two vectors and, in particular, it helps us determine whether two given vectors are perpendicular.

The bilinearity and symmetry properties of the dot product yield its binomial identities.

Let us now turn to the reason why we are interested in the dot product in the first place: the number which it associates to two given vectors has a geometric interpretation which is very useful. In particular, it provides us with a simple test to determine if two vectors are perpendicular.
